meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unpleasant or of poor quality.
meanings.sent1: The movie's suckiness made everyone leave the theater early.
meanings.sent2: I can't stand the suckiness of this broken chair.
meanings.sent3: The suckiness of the rainy weather ruined our picnic plans.
meanings.sent4: The suckiness of the situation was like a dark cloud hanging over us.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's strict rules added an extra layer of suckiness to the class.

meanings.definition: The act of sucking or drawing in with the mouth.
meanings.sent1: The baby's suckiness on the pacifier was adorable.
meanings.sent2: The vacuum cleaner's suckiness picked up all the dirt from the carpet.
meanings.sent3: The kitten's suckiness on the milk was a cute sight to see.
meanings.sent4: The black hole's suckiness was so strong, nothing could escape.
meanings.sent5: The straw's suckiness helped me enjoy my milkshake.

meanings.definition: A feeling of disappointment or dissatisfaction.
meanings.sent1: The team felt the suckiness of losing the championship game.
meanings.sent2: Her face showed the suckiness of not getting the promotion.
meanings.sent3: The birthday cake's suckiness was that it tasted like cardboard.
meanings.sent4: The suckiness of waiting in line felt like an eternity.
meanings.sent5: The suckiness of failing the test was hard to shake off.
